citeinfo.origin: National Research Institute of Far Seas Fisheries
citeinfo.title: Effects of Nutrients on Phytoplankton Size in the Bering Sea Basin

descript.abstract: Surface nutrients [NO2 + NO3, Si(OH)4, PO4] concentrations are generally higher in winter than in summer in the Bering Sea basin, whereas concentrations in both seasons are nearly equal at water depths greater than 200-300 m. Surface silicates are relatively low compared to other nutrients concentrations in summer, whereas a linear relationship is found between nitrite + nitrate and phosphate.
descript.purpose: To show the effects of Nutrients on Phytoplankton Size in the Bering Sea Basin

cntaddr.address: National Research Institute of Far Seas Fisheries
